The claim was made by West Virginia Sen: Shelley Moore Capito in an August 20 Facebook post.
The claim cited a study by the Competiti: 3. The study estimated the potential costs of the Green New Deal on households in five states: Florida, New Hampshire, New Mexico, Pennsylvania, and Alaska.
The study considered factors such as inc: upgrading vehicles and housing, and elements of shipping, but acknowledged the inability to estimate the price tag for certain costly elements of the plan.
